text: The 1920-21 Austrian football championship was organized by the Lower Austrian Football Association and contested by its members. The newly created federal state associations organized state championships in different modes for the first time. SK Rapid Wien became Austrian football champions for the seventh time. They reached the title hat-trick in 1919 to 1921. The Wiener Amateur SV and Vienna played a large part of their home games on other grounds because their homegrounds were renovated. ==Table== Table mode (if points are tied):Number of wins - goal quotient Pl. Vinzenz Dittrich, Josef Dworak, Hans Geiger, Leopold Grundwald, Karl Klär, Heinrich Körner, August Kraupar, Richard Kuthan, Niehsner, Leopold Nitsch, Franz Schediwy, Franz Schlosser, Stefan Sudrich, Tomsche, Josef Uridil, Werner, Ferdinand Wesely, Gustav Wieser, Leopold Witka, Karl Wondrak Coach: Dionys Schönecker Austria Soccer ==Champions of the Federal states == * Lower Austriaː SV Stockerau 07 * Upper Austria - Salzburgː SK Vorwärts Steyr * Styriaː SK Sturm Graz * Tyrolː SV Innsbruck * Vorarlbergː FC Lustenau 07 The Vorarlberg state championship was a bit strange in the early years. There were only very few clubs and they did not want to take part in the championship at the beginning. The only participant in the Vorarlberg championship this season was FC Lustenau 07, who won the title by defeating their own B team. ==References == Category:Football in Austria Category:Football seasons Category:1920 in association football Category:1921 in association football Category:1920s in Austria Category:Seasons in European football
title: 1920-21 Austrian football championship
